text:
Hello everyone, I have an issue with the thumbnail of the post, so I'm leaving a question.

If you post a recent post, it will work well on the distributed site, but other portal sites will see the wrong feature image. Is there anything I can do to help resolve this issue?

*If you look at the attached picture, number 1 is the feature image specified in the blog post, number 2 is the visible image in the domain that was actually uploaded,
Number 3 is an image that comes out when you search on another company's site. *
What if you check the page with an OG checker to make sure the pictures are set correctly?
Hi guys, I'm creating an app inside HubSpot right now, I picked only 2 scopes, but when I access the `Install URL (OAuth)` and choose an account, I get this error.
As i can see, both checked scopes on App Auth page, are present on the URL

Thank you very much for <@U033VNNBBBP> reply.

As a result of pressing the url check button on the post through the openGraph site you told me, you will get a preview result that it is coming out well on Facebook, disk, Twitter, and LinkedIn (see the picture below)
But I live in Korea and the results are not coming out properly on naver, the largest portal used in Korea. There seems to be a way to verify this. Also, I was able to confirm that about one out of 10 came out properly.
